Description: Rim sherd (mended from two fragments) of large Chian Grand Style pottery light chalice; greyish-white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; part of rosette and lotus-palmette in added white outline with added red centres; top of lip glazed; exterior: band of short vertical strokes between pairs of brown lines; below, painted decoration consisting of upper part of beardless, naked man (light brown coloured flesh, white with brown iris for eye; red taenia tied round his head with left hand raised holding a wreath), to right; on left, part of undetermined dark brown motif (?foot of dancing figure).
Curator's comments: The number 500 is written in pencil on the interior.
Bibliographic references: Price 1924 / Pottery of Naukratis (pl. XI, third row)
Walter-Karydi 1973 / Samische Gefässe des 6. Jahrhunderts vor Christi: Landschaftsstile ostgriechischer Gefässe (p. 140, no.793, pl. 96)
Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 274, no. 725, pl.95)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0767) (phase 2)
